intro: Toxocarpus crassifolius, commonly known as the broad-leafed toxocarpus, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, broad leaves and showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in coastal areas and disturbed soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
